pr_title: Create a Camel ReactiveStreams extension (initial implementation)

timeline.bodyText: Is this really necessary? If so we'll need to whitelist in https://github.com/apache/camel-quarkus/pull/647/files/36102f2f069a3e3ad9aa27255b2c6b6f80d78b70#diff-87b8f9583824da15e8833362367682ecR79
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: It probably not, I'll check but I really dislike the idea to have to make changes to core in order to register something an extension eventually need
replies.author: lburgazzoli

timeline.bodyText: Why optional? Are there alternative implementations already now (or planned in near future)? Are we not unnecessarily overcomplicating it?
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: yes there are some additional implementations I''d like to make later on, please have a look about how camel-reactive-extension works.
replies.author: lburgazzoli

timeline.author: ppalaga

timeline.bodyText: Could the class be static maybe?
timeline.author: ppalaga

timeline.bodyText: It could perhaps be made less deadlock-prone using synchronize(this.lock) (the lock being from ServiceSupport)?
timeline.author: ppalaga

timeline.bodyText: I think 1.0.0 is going to be the next?
timeline.author: ppalaga
timeline.diffHunk:

+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>org.apache.camel.quarkus</groupId>
+        <artifactId>camel-quarkus-reactive-streams-parent</artifactId>
+        <version>1.1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+        <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+    </parent>
+
+    <artifactId>camel-quarkus-reactive-streams</artifactId>
+    <name>Camel Quarkus :: Reactive Streams :: Runtime</name>
+
+    <properties>
+        <firstVersion>1.2.0</firstVersion>

replies.bodyText: btw, this is what the extension generator does
replies.author: lburgazzoli

replies.bodyText: Yes, the snapshot version in our poms is not what the generator assumes. It is hard to fix unless we stick to a stable versioning policy.
replies.author: ppalaga
